intro: Couma dulcis, commonly known as the sweet senna, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its seeds, which are enclosed in pods, contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal uses. The botanical features of Couma dulcis make it an important species in both ecological and pharmaceutical contexts.
